ddf.catalog.validation.impl.validator

Class RangeValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.catalog.validation.impl.validator.RangeValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeValidator

    public class RangeValidator
extends Object
implements AttributeValidator
    Validates an attribute's value(s) against an inclusive numeric range.

    Is capable of validating Numbers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RangeValidator(BigDecimal min, BigDecimal max)
      Creates a RangeValidator with an inclusive range.

      Creates a RangeValidator with an inclusive range and the provided epsilon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RangeValidator

        public RangeValidator(BigDecimal min,
                      BigDecimal max)
        Creates a RangeValidator with an inclusive range.

        Uses an epsilon of 1e-6 on both sides of the range to account for floating point representation inaccuracies, so the range is really [min - epsilon, max + epsilon].

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum allowable value (inclusive), cannot be null
        max - the maximum allowable value (inclusive), cannot be null and must be greater than min
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if max is not greater than min or either is null

      • RangeValidator

        public RangeValidator(BigDecimal min,
                      BigDecimal max,
                      BigDecimal epsilon)
        Creates a RangeValidator with an inclusive range and the provided epsilon.

        Uses the provided epsilon on both sides of the range to account for floating point representation inaccuracies, so the range is really [min - epsilon, max + epsilon].

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum allowable value (inclusive), cannot be null
        max - the maximum allowable value (inclusive), cannot be null and must be greater than min
        epsilon - the epsilon value, cannot be null and must be positive
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if max is not greater than min, epsilon is not positive, or if any argument is null

      • validate

        public Optional<AttributeValidationReport> validate(Attribute attribute)
        Description copied from interface: AttributeValidator
        Validates a single Attribute.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface AttributeValidator
        Parameters:
        attribute - the Attribute to validate, cannot be null
        Returns:
        an Optional containing an AttributeValidationReport if there are violations, or an empty Optional if there are no violations
